Rep: Lewis cited a U.S. intelligence report that claimed Russia had conducted an "influence campaign" to help elect Trump and believed that Trump was not a legitimate president.
It was discovered that Rep: Lewis had also boycotted George W. Bush's 2001 inauguration, as he did not believe Bush was the true elected president due to the controversies surrounding the election results in Florida and the intervention of the U.S. Supreme Court.
Lewis: s spokeswoman confirmed that he had missed the first inauguration of President George W. Bush and stated that his absence at that time was also a form of dissent, as he did not believe the outcome of the election reflected a fair and open democratic process.
